page.title: 04THERFIELD HEATH
page.content: Part of this SSSI is in the north of this block.These virgin chalkdowns support many rarities.FLOWERS_Spotted catsear,Kidney vetch,Bee_burnttip_ fragrant & pyramid orchids,a rare microspecies of dandelion & the largest G.B. colony of Pasque flowers. BIRDS_meadowpipit,Green woodpecker, Wood & Grasshopper warblers. MOTHS_ Shaded pug,Barred hooptip.BUTTERFLIES_ Brown argus,Dingy skipper,chalkhill blue.SNAILS_Heath & Round mouthed.Also Fieldvole,Rabbit,Common lizard.A body of Conservators administer the Heath balancing nature with the demands from Royston for recreational amenities. Constituted in 1888 they represent stint holding farmers in Therfield. 1 stint= 4 sheep,grazing from April_ November.More of the heath is in the next block.
